alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 1:13PM MDT until April 04 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 2 AM TODAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND WESTERN NM BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TODAY TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR ALL OF EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE AND POOR HUMIDITY RECOVERY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM TUESDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .As strong to damaging winds develop along with a continued drying of the atmosphere, critical fire weather will impact much of the region today. These critical conditions will persist through the overnight and into Tuesday across all of eastern New Mexico and then redevelop over parts of central New Mexico by Tuesday afternoon. Winds will finally taper off Tuesday night with very cold temperatures and higher humidity to alleviate critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) and the Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124) from 9 am to 2 am today into tonight then again from 10 am to 9 pm Tuesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph today. West winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 6 and 13 percent today and Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
